{"step_by_step_thinking": "A person on a fat-free carbohydrate-rich diet is likely to have elevated levels of VLDL (Very Low-Density Lipoprotein) in their blood. This is because a high-carbohydrate diet can increase the production of triglycerides, which are transported by VLDL. Since the person is obese, their body may have an impaired ability to clear VLDL from the blood, leading to elevated levels.", "answer_choice": "B"}
